title: ‘It’s missing something’: AGI, superintelligence and a race for the future
description: As US and Chinese tech giants chase artificial general intelligence, experts warn the hype may be outrunning the science
content:

title: AI Boom, Entry-Level Bust: Why College Grads Are Struggling to Land Jobs
description: As artificial intelligence transforms the job market, recent college graduates are finding it harder to land entry-level roles in competitive fields like tech and finance — even with strong résumés and top internships. Economists point to a surge in AI adoption, along with a slowdown in post-pandemic hiring, as key factors driving unemployment among college grads above the national average. Financial leaders like Centerview Partners’ Blair Effron warn that although the AI revolution will boost long-term productivity, short-term impacts on employment will be swift and dramatic. (Source: Bloomberg)
content:
00:00

title: Use of AI to change Bollywood hit’s tragic ending sparks debate
description: An obsessive lover dies mourning his unrequited love – this has been the cornerstone of Raanjhanaa, a 2013 Bollywood hit that remains popular for its tragic rendition of an all-consuming love, shaping onscreen memories for an entire generation of Indian filmgoers. The Hindi film was also released in Tamil as Ambikapathy that year. But in a new Tamil version of the film, the hero lives on, thanks to artificial intelligence (AI) that was used to change the movie’s ending. Read more at straitstimes.com.
content:
A release poster for Ambikapathy. The film, which was originally released in 2013, has been re-released with a new AI-edited ending.
– An obsessive lover dies mourning his unrequited love – this has been the cornerstone of Raanjhanaa, a 2013 Bollywoo... [360 chars]
